!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 17, 2002 17:25:24.01
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 17, 2002 17:25:24.01
!MESSAGE java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
	<<no stack trace available>>

- What are you doing when the out of memory error occurs? Building?  Checking 
out from the repository?  Were you doing the same thing for every one of these 
errors, or were they occurring as you did different things?

- Do you have any extra plugins installed, or is it just the plain F3 
SDK download?

- How many projects do you have in your workspace?  How many files in total?

- Does this appear to be a new error, or has this problem occurred with similar 
steps in other eclipse builds?

- We have checked out from the repository und rebuild all. The errors occur as 
we did different things (check out, rebuild, opening files). 
- No we haven?t installed any extra plugins, just the plain F3 eclipse. 
- We have 3 project and 10.240 files in total 
- No this bug occur only in the version F3. We have now installed the F2 
version and we haven?t any problems.

You might be specifying your VM arguments incorrectly.  The format is:

eclipse [platform options] [-vmargs [Java VM arguments]]

If you're not doing so already, try running again with:

eclipse <eclipse-args-here> -vmargs -Xmx128M

Thank you.

We have forgotten the -vmargs in front of -Xmx128M

But it is not very userfriendly. Perhaps it is possible to check it automatic 
and to give a better error message.

In my opinion, this is to tricky for many new eclipse users.

This is a problem for the VM.  Most VMs (IBM JRE 1.3 or greater, J9, Sun 1.4) 
can handle eclipse without any additional VM arguments.  The fact that your 
particular VM is running out of heap space is not something we can easily check 
or work around.  I think the best we can do is include a comment in the readme 
file telling users to set the max heap size for older VMs.

Now I have installed eclipse GM1 und Sun jdk 1.4.1 b14. Starting eclipse 
without -vmargs -Xmx I have still a out of memory exception.

What I have done: Checkout of 4 projects.

Hardware: IBM thinkpad A21p with 400MB real memory.

!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 4 Jun 25, 2002 09:09:36.434
!MESSAGE Unhandled exception caught in event loop.
!ENTRY org.eclipse.ui 4 0 Jun 25, 2002 09:09:39.768
!MESSAGE java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
!STACK 0
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

This is surprising.  I've never used the -Xmx flag and I've never experienced 
OutOfMemoryErrors unless there was a programming error.  How big are these 
projects being checked out?  I wonder if your use of an unsupported CVS version 
is part of the problem.  Michael, are there known memory issues with using CVS 
1.11, or other reports of OutOfMemoryError on checkout?
We haven't had any out of memory issues with CVS.

The 4 modules in CVS have 10.000 files in total (3000 java files). Size of all 
files 200MB.

The out of memory exception was after the checkout of the 4 modules und after 
the build of the 4 projects -> during opening a java class in the java 
perspective.

Now I have started eclipse again with the -vmargs -Xmx256M option and I have no 
more exceptions.

Closing.  The workspace was corrupted by the out of memory error.  Starting 
again with a clean workspace and sufficient memory fixed the problem.
